snippet: Federal prosecutors say Enrique Marquez, who bought the assault rifles used in the massacre in San Bernardino, Calif., conspired to commit terrorism in 2011 and 2012.
abstract: United States officials arrest Enrique Marquez, who bought and supplied assault rifles used to kill 14 people in San Bernardino, Calif, massacre, and charge him with crimes including conspiring to support terrorists; court documents filed reveal how attacker Syed Rizwan Farook, who was longtime neighbor and friend of Marquez, became radicalized.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and IAN LOVETT
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Riverside, Calif., Richard Pérez-Peña from New York and Ian Lovett from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors say Enrique Marquez, who bought the assault rifles used in the massacre in San Bernardino, Calif., conspired to commit terrorism in 2011 and 2012.

headline.main: Neighbor of San Bernardino Attackers Faces Terrorism Charges
headline.print_headline: Friend Conspired to Aid Terrorists in Attack, U.S. Says
